column1: Nkanyezi walked all day. She hiked up a hill
column2: and down into a valley. She sailed across the great river
column3: and climbed between sharp rocks. She marched across the plains until she reached the shadow of the red mountains. As night was closing in
column4: Nkanyezi arrived at a village of patterns and colors as she had never seen before. She told the village elders about her journey to bring back the spirit of celebration to her people. The mother of this tribe gave Nkanyezi a gift. She told the girl
column5: "With love we give to you this paint to restore color to your village." Nkanyezi thanked the elders and put the paint in her bag. Early the next morning she went on her way. Nkanyezi walked all day
column6: through a vast forest of giant trees. As the sky became too dark for her to see
column7: she heard the sound of beating drums. She hurried towards the drumming
column8: feeling the spirit of dance coming to her tired feet.
